Artillery.description: High-damage, long-range artillery that focus on area damage and deal more damage based on the number of targets they hit.
Very mobile, teleporting artillery that consistently deal high damage.
Long-range artillery that shoot delayed-impact rockets, dealing significant damage.
Exceptionally long-ranged and accurate artillery that can deal damage directly to a mech’s structure under the right circumstances.

Controller.description: Controllers that deal relatively high damage and force their enemies to choose between immobility or taking additional damage..
Controllers that create cover for allies and lock down fast-moving enemies.
Controllers that create areas that damage enemies and protect allies, forcing opponents to move around.
Very fast, hard to hit controllers that inflict conditions on enemies at the price of being vulnerable to conditions themselves.
Controllers that focus on denying an area using traps and mines.
Nasty controllers that inflict conditions and heat on enemies.

Defender.description: Shield-bearing defenders that protect nearby allies from harm.
Slow, high-damage defenders that are resistant to melee damage and very dangerous at close range.
Enormous defenders that can taunt enemies or pin them at close range, and must be fought up-close.
Slow-moving defenders that deal damage in an area at close range and generate energy shields to protect their allies.
Relatively fast defenders that specialize at protecting nearby allies.

Striker.description: Fast-flying strikers with the ability to negate burst damage.
Mobile strikers that excel at hunting down single targets.
Hardy strikers that deal consistent damage.
Fast melee strikers that are dangerous in close combat but risk harming allies.
Fast-moving strikers that can drag their enemies along with them.
Strikers that deploy turrets, rapidly increasing their damage output if not dealt with.
Melee duelists that can reflect ranged attacks and deal area damage at close range.
Mobile, invisible strikers that get bonuses when attacking solitary targets.
Relatively slow strikers that deal high damage to individual targets and get benefits against enemies they have already hit.

Support.description: Hardy supports that use shields to protect areas of the map.
Supports that don’t deal any damage, but can turn their allies invisible and teleport them around.
Technical supports that can connect their systems with those of allies, enhancing them at the cost of increasing their own vulnerability.
Supports that make targets vulnerable and prevent enemies from hiding or becoming invisible.
Pure supports that repair their allies and clear conditions.
